greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Lexicographically earliest such sequence a that a(i) = a(j) => f(i) = f(j) for all i, j, where f(n) = 0 if n is an odd squarefree number > 1, and f(n) = n for all other numbers.
link: Antti Karttunen, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..65537
formula: a(1) = 1, a(2) = 2, for n > 2, if n is an odd squarefree number (in A056911), a(n) = 3, otherwise a(n) = running count from 4 onward.
program: rgs_transform(invec) = { my(om = Map(), outvec = vector(length(invec)), u=1); for(i=1, length(invec), if(mapisdefined(om,invec[i]), my(pp = mapget(om, invec[i])); outvec[i] = outvec[pp] , mapput(om,invec[i],i); outvec[i] = u; u++ )); outvec; };
xref: Cf. A056911 (after the initial 1, gives the positions of 3's in this sequence).
results.author: _Antti Karttunen_, Dec 27 2018
